author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four people, including an elderly woman, drowned in the Bay of Bengal in different places since Sunday evening.

Kalyan (29), working at a software firm in Taramani, had gone to Elliots Beach in Besant Nagar on Sunday. He was frolicking in the water, when he was dragged into the water by a wave. Noticing him struggling, other visitors jumped into the water and pulled him out. They rushed him to the Government Royapettah Hospital, where he was pronounced dead on arrival, police said.

Vinod (24) of Velachery, visited Elliot’s Beach with his friends. When he ventured slightly into the water, he was swept away by a wave and he drowned, police said.

At Tiruvanmiyur, the body of a woman, reported to be around 60 years of age, was washed ashore. Police said the victim was yet to be identified.

In another incident, the body of a 40-year-old man was washed ashore near Muttukadu.

Kanathur police suspect the victim to have been drowned after being drawn into the water by a strong wave.
title: Four incidents of drowning off city beaches
